content.question:
For parts of the free response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate.

For parts of the free response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate.

A student performs a spectrophotometry experiment using solutions of <math alttext="N i, open parenthesis, C l O 4, close parenthesis, 2, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ni</mi><msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>ClO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>. The student needs to make a standard curve and determine the concentration of <math alttext="N i, open parenthesis, C l O 4, close parenthesis, 2, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ni</mi><msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>ClO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> in a sample with an unknown concentration.

(a) Based on the absorbance spectrum of <math alttext="N i, open parenthesis, C l O 4, close parenthesis, 2, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ni</mi><msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>ClO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> shown in the preceding graph, what wavelength should the student use in the experiment to achieve the greatest precision?

frqParts.text:
For parts of the free response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate.

For parts of the free response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate.

A student performs a spectrophotometry experiment using solutions of <math alttext="N i, open parenthesis, C l O 4, close parenthesis, 2, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ni</mi><msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>ClO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>. The student needs to make a standard curve and determine the concentration of <math alttext="N i, open parenthesis, C l O 4, close parenthesis, 2, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ni</mi><msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>ClO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> in a sample with an unknown concentration.

(a) Based on the absorbance spectrum of <math alttext="N i, open parenthesis, C l O 4, close parenthesis, 2, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ni</mi><msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>ClO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> shown in the preceding graph, what wavelength should the student use in the experiment to achieve the greatest precision?

(b) To make the standard curve, the student must prepare <math alttext="N i, open parenthesis, C l O 4, close parenthesis, 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ni</mi><msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>ClO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> solutions with different concentrations. The student has a standard solution of <math alttext="N i, open parenthesis, C l O 4, close parenthesis, 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ni</mi><msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>ClO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> with a concentration of <math alttext="0.198 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.198</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></math>. Calculate the volume, in <math alttext="milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>mL</mtext></math>, of <math alttext="0.198 molar N i, open parenthesis, C l O 4, close parenthesis, 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.198</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi>Ni</mi><msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>ClO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> that is needed to prepare <math alttext="250.0 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>250.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mL</mi></math> of <math alttext="0.0400 molar N i, open parenthesis, C l O 4, close parenthesis, 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.0400</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi>Ni</mi><msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>ClO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>.

(c) The standard curve generated by the student is provided above. The student measures an absorbance of <math alttext="0.30" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.30</mn></math> for the unknown solution. Using the standard curve provided, determine the molarity of <math alttext="N i, open parenthesis, C l O 4, close parenthesis, 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ni</mi><msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>ClO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> in the unknown solution.

(d) A second student repeats the procedure using the same spectrophotometer but makes an error, which results in the dashed line shown in the graph above. Assuming that the first student’s data (shown by the solid line) are correct, identify one error that could account for the second student’s standard curve being less steep than that obtained by the first student.

skill.text: 2.D: Make observations or collect data from representations of laboratory setups or results, while attending to precision where appropriate.
